oh this is Bill Cunningham and I'm still
focused on Paris there was so much
excitement and so much to tell you this
week I thought we'd focus on what I saw
as a real genuine trend an evolution of
the black leather biker jacket it's been
around forever but it's now reached a
popularity and taken on a life of its
own in Paris where women are mixing it
with what i would call proper business
clothes potty clothes everything you
could think of it's the out aware of
choice it just really it is the
equivalent of what blue jeans were to
the 70s 80s and 90s the bikers jacket is
now the element of fashion that ties it
all together and even two of the design
houses showed especially the Japanese
designer jr. one tanabe he created an
entire collection based on the bike his
jacket mixed with tweeds and everything
you can think of and even the evening
black evening dresses the jackets
weren't separate they were part of the
dress sometimes you only got the front
of it sometimes the call is Alyssa it
was just marvelous and then the other
house that really did an innovative take
on it Ricardo 2g 4g von she they took
the bikers jacket cut the shoulders and
sleeves off and repositioned it under
the arms as a corset zipping down over
the hips it just had the right
nonchalance of this generation instead
of being all dressed up you know ooh la
la Perry it wasn't that at all this was
modern Paris and of course we've seen it
here in New York and everything
nothing to the extent that which I saw
it in Paris I mean it is epidemic and it
also reflected the revival of grunge if
you can believe it although I don't see
a large population into that although
very expensive they didn't just pick it
up in a secondhand shop or a jumble sale
it just it brand about with me and I
thought isn't that great taking
something we're all familiar with that
Marlon Brando made it very popular in
the wild one but here it comes a new
generation cutting up the jacket reap
putting it together in a new way Wow
here we've got something new
